criterion: Confirms secondary data (order #, email, phone) before discussing order/account [Notes: nan]

criterion:
Agent verifies return eligibility, provides correct RMA instructions, and explains applicable fees or conditions per policy. [Notes: - New items: 30-day return window
- Pre-owned/luxury: 14-day window
- RMA valid 10 days
- Restocking fees may apply]
pass: Explains return window and RMA steps correctly.
fail: Gives incorrect return timeframe or fails to issue RMA.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: I can help you start a return. You’ll receive an RMA email with your prepaid label—it’s valid for 10 days.

criterion:
Agent confirms order status and provides accurate cancellation and refund guidance per fulfillment stage. [Notes: - Same-day or warehouse stage only
- Shipped orders handled as returns
- Must confirm refund timeline]
pass: Provides correct cancellation steps and refund timeline.
fail: Promises cancellation after shipment or gives wrong refund info.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: Since your order hasn’t shipped yet, I can cancel it for you. Refunds appear within 3–5 business days to your original payment method.

criterion:
Agent handles address corrections or reroutes within policy limits and verifies customer identity before changes. [Notes: - Reroutes allowed only before shipment
- Verification required before changes
- Must confirm any fees or delays]
pass: Executes address change or reroute per policy and confirms verification.
fail: Makes unauthorized change or misses verification.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: Let me verify your order details first. Once confirmed, I’ll request an address correction with our carrier.

criterion:
Agent assists customer with reshipment or replacement after validating damage or carrier claim eligibility. [Notes: - Lost/damaged items handled similarly
- Reshipment only after claim approval
- Include photos/documentation if needed]
pass: Guides customer through claim or reship correctly per policy.
fail: Promises replacement before claim approval or mishandles claim flow.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: I’m sorry your order arrived damaged. I’ll file a claim with the carrier and arrange a replacement once it’s approved.

criterion:
Agent explains warranty coverage and assists in initiating a claim or manufacturer referral as needed. [Notes: - Manufacturer vs Extend coverage differ
- Extend covers mechanical only, not accidental
- Warranty claims handled under Returns]
pass: Explains warranty terms accurately and directs next steps.
fail: Gives incorrect warranty information or fails to assist with claim.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: Your watch includes a manufacturer warranty for mechanical issues. I can help you start that claim today.

criterion:
Agent accurately explains inventory or fulfillment status and sets correct expectations for shipment or restock timelines. [Notes: - Applies to preorder/backorder/out-of-stock

criterion: Allow double-scoring across Returns, Damage Discounts, and Revenue Protection if the interaction spans categories; this is permitted but not required if one section is clearly primary. Treat any rubric item not triggered by the call’s context as not applicable (N/A) and do not penalize; if the agent’s behavior is neutral and no rule is triggered or violated, default to Pass. Apply rubric criteria strictly and literally, using the numeric thresholds and caps embedded in each item; do not infer or relax rules based on tone or intent. Refund timelines are universal (3–5 business days depending on bank). Battery coverage requires the correct tier/cap to be stated. Prohibited shipping items must be communicated when relevant (e.g., fragrances internationally, alligator bands, other restricted categories). Use only the rubric items provided; do not invent new checks [Notes: nan]

- Applies to all call types]
pass: Summarizes actions and information accurately.
fail: Ends call without summarizing key details.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: So to recap, your return has been approved and you’ll receive the RMA email within 24 hours.

criterion:
Agent provides clear next steps and expected timelines for resolution or delivery. [Notes: - Must specify both action and time frame
- Timelines must align with policy]
pass: Explains next steps and gives accurate timeline.
fail: Fails to mention follow-up steps or gives vague timeline.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: You’ll get your refund confirmation within 24 hours, and it should appear on your card in 3–5 business days.

criterion:
Agent offers additional help before ending the call. [Notes: - Required closing question
- Applies to all call types]
pass: Asks if customer needs any further help before closing.
fail: Ends call without offering further assistance.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: Is there anything else I can help you with today?

criterion:
Agent ends the call politely and professionally, expressing gratitude and maintaining brand tone. [Notes: - Must include thanks or polite closing
- Avoid abrupt or unprofessional tone]
pass: Closes with gratitude and professional tone.
fail: Ends abruptly or without polite closing.
na: N/A unless applicable (multiple subcodes may apply).
agent_script_example: Thank you for calling Jomashop. Have a wonderful day!
